intro: Pogonostigma boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's beard-tongue, is a species of flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
